intro: Agnus-castus vulgaris var. alba, commonly known as the white velvet tamarisk, is a variant of the common agnus castus. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, characterized by its ornamental white flowers. The plant is native to southern Europe and parts of the Mediterranean region. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves, and it is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens.
